description.plain:
Jidenna is Brooklyn-based, but Wisconsin-born. He was born in Wisconsin, raised in Nigeria and then Massachusetts, went to college at Stanford, pursued his career in various parts of California, and now lives in East Flatbush, Brooklyn.

His name in Igbo means ‘to embrace the father’. An adept artist and performer, his music nominally falls under the hip hop umbrella, but has a place in PR&B.

He is also a founding member of the social club Fear & Fancy, which was founded in 2006, which is described as ‘A combination of hip hop and Kaplan’.

songs.full_title: Classic Man by Jidenna (Ft. Roman GianArthur)
songs.title: Classic Man

description.plain:
In the lead single off of Wondaland Records' upcoming compilation EP The Eephus, Brooklyn-born rapper Jidenna fashions himself a “classic man” who stays true to old-fashioned values and beliefs. “Classic Man” peaked at 26 on the Billboard Hot 100.

Check out the official Kendrick Lamar remix here!

I'm a classic man

I'm a classic man

I'm a classic man

I'm a classic man
Old fashioned man

songs.title: Bambi

description.plain:
“Bambi” is the fourth single from Jidenna’s debut album The Chief.

It is a love song where Jidenna laments on the complications that keep him away from the one he loves. The song is a west African high life song with impressive vocals

The title references the deer “Bambi,” the main character of both the original book by Felix Salten and the 1942 Walt Disney film adaptation.

Throughout the song, Jidenna uses homophones representing animals in the hierarchy of a jungle, while also addressing his “dear,” and things he can’t be to maintain a relationship: a liar or cheater.

songs.embed_content: Read “Bambi” by Jidenna on Genius

body.plain:
“Bambi” is the fourth single from Jidenna’s debut album The Chief.

It is a love song where Jidenna laments on the complications that keep him away from the one he loves. The song is a west African high life song with impressive vocals

The title references the deer “Bambi,” the main character of both the original book by Felix Salten and the 1942 Walt Disney film adaptation.

Throughout the song, Jidenna uses homophones representing animals in the hierarchy of a jungle, while also addressing his “dear,” and things he can’t be to maintain a relationship: a liar or cheater.

songs.full_title: Long Live the Chief by Jidenna
songs.title: Long Live the Chief

description.plain:
“Long Live the Chief” tells the story of Jidenna’s upbringing and aspirations. As a proclamation of purpose, it is the perfect complement to the “Classic Man” single, explaining Jidenna’s intent to continue his father’s legacy as a “chief” or dignified leader. Jidenna himself has used the “chief” label since the mid-00s, and the term is a favorite of his Fear and Fancy Social Club.

This one-verse banger is rife with references to political terminology and categories of leader, often woven in via double-entendre: along with chief, we have captain, 100 year plan, run, party, lobby, fresh prince, dead presidents, governor, and diplomat; additionally he name-drops Shaka Zulu, the Kennedy clan, and U.S. presidents Bill Clinton and Barack Obama.

The fifth episode of Netflix’s Luke Cage features a musical performance from Jidenna of “Long Live the Chief.”

songs.embed_content: Read “Long Live the Chief” by Jidenna on Genius
